page.title: 15N. WALNEY NATURE RESERVE 1
page.content:
The North of Walney is now a grade A Nature Reserve for animals like the {Natterjack Toad.}This toad is now protected by the law because it is the rarest British amphibian. Walney Island is the only Island in the world where the Natterjack Toad breeds.
Very rare birds breed there like the {peregrine falcon}and kestrel. This year the falcons have been kept under a 24 hour guard by the wardens to prevent the eggs being stolen. Seagulls breed in the reserve on the south of the Island. There are some swans and owls on the Island as well.
There are lots of butterflies like the Red Admiral and many insects like dragon flies, bees, spiders and moths.
